content: my gentle protector my gentle protector is a simple hat that is designed to showcase a few of your most precious buttons worked with two different yarns held together it knits up quickly and is luxuriously soft gently protecting your ears from the cold size to fit average adult woman s head when the hat is lying flat it measures 26cm/10 25in across the brim is stretchy and can accommodate heads of much larger circumference yarn one ball of garnstudio drops alpaca shown here in shade 100 100% alpaca 50gr=166m/1 76oz=182yd one ball of rowan kidsilk haze shown here in shade 634 70% mohair 30% silk 25gr=209m/0 88oz=229yd needles 3 25mm/us size 3 these can be either straight or circular 3 5mm/us size 4 these can be either circular or double-pointed buttons i used three buttons with a diameter of 1 5cm/0 6in pepper knitting mill my gentle protector gauge using one strand of each yarn held together 23 stitches and 29 row = 10cm/4in stocking stitch 3 5mm needles 23 stitches and 46 row = 10cm/4in garter stitch 3 25mm needles note my personal knitting gauge tends to be on the loose side so if your gauge is usually tight it might be a good idea to use needles a size larger than the sizes i used notes the hat is worked from the brim to the crown the brim is worked flat in garter stitch and then the main body is worked in the round there are no button holes the buttons are simply sewn on after the knitting has been completed instructions brim using 3 25mm needles and one strand of each yarn cast on 120 stitches leaving a tail of about 30cm/11 5in i used the german long-tail cast on but you can use whichever cast on you prefer do not join stitches for working in the round knitting back and forth work in garter stitch until the piece measures 7cm/2 75in if you are working to the given gauge you will have worked 32 row transition between brim and body change to 3 5mm needles knit until there are 8 stitches remaining on the 3 25mm needle place marker for the beginning of the round join for knitting in the round hold the 8 remaining stitches on the 3 25mm needle behind the first 8 stitches on the 3 5mm needle the stitches from the beginning of the round *knit 1st stitch from the front needle together with 1st stitch from back needle repeat from * seven more times there are now 112 stitches on the 3 5mm needles and none on the 3 25mm needles from now on knitting will be done in the round body knit in stocking stitch until the piece measures 18cm/7in from cast on edge if you are working to the given gauge you will have worked 30 row crown decreases
